result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa Marie Krey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court reads-in and dismisses Counts 2 and 3 for restitution purposes.
Defendant to report to Probation today January 11, 2016.
Probation may be transferred to Minnesota.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$821.01 restitution which Co-Defendant has paid $732.00 in restitution.
Apply bond on file.

-Defendant to continue all therapy and treatment.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for good time.
Huber granted for work.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Alex Stormont, DF: Lisa Marie Krey appeared.  Court called at 10:33 a.m.  Set for Plea/Sentencing.   DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1.  Crt reviews the Criminal Complaint.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1.  On motion of the State, Crt merges in for restitution purposes and dismisses Ct 2 & Ct 3. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:

W/S 2 years probation with conditions
- DE ordered to pay restitution in the amount of $821.01 to be joint and several with the co-defendant.  (Co-defendant has paid $732.00) Apply money on file.  
- Court costs of $268.00 apply money on file
- DE ordered to continue all therapy and treatment
- Probation may be transferred to Minnesota
- DE to report to probation today 01/11/16
- 20 days to appeal
Plea hearing at 01-11-2016 10:30 am

CO: TCH for EFV, Recorded, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Sharon Correll,  DF ATTY:  Lida Marie Bannink   DF:  Lisa Marie Krey appeared. Case called at 11:13 a.m.  Officer Katie Chevrier w/New Richmond PD appears. Includes 14CF509 and 14CF510.  S/T Officer Chevrier, ADA Correll questions. Court notes Defendant's are identified.  Cross by Atty Bannink.  Cross by Atty Smestad. Cross by ADA Correll. Officer released. Atty Banniink states Ms. Krey should not be bound over due to burden of proof. per Defendant in court. eif
filed by Liesl Nelson; hereby appointing atty Lida Bannink.
Preliminary hearing on December 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Wal-Mart in New Richmond WI or premises.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EFV, RPT: Elizabeth Frank, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Sharon Correll,  DF ATTY:  Joseph Caton,  DF:  Lisa Marie Krey appeared from jail. Defendant does qualify for PD. Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 11, 2014 at 11:00 am.
